alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 2:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Douglas and northwestern Elbert Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 214 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles east of The Pinery to 4 miles east of Elbert, or along a line extending from 24 miles southeast of Denver to 29 miles northeast of Colorado Springs. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, winds in excess of 40 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southern Parker, Elbert, Elizabeth, Kiowa, Ponderosa Park, The Pinery and Franktown. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet
